Hi Jim, found these two

http://tinyurl.com/u0wl


This one is pretty interesting, I assume this is the one you were mentioning.
http://tinyurl.com/u0wo

Rich




  ----- Original Message ----- 
  From: Jim Gilbert 
  To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Friday, November 07, 2003 12:48 PM
  Subject: Re: [nihontostudy] anyone for a piece of history


  Sometimes the motif of that type of pommel is identified as a phoenix, at other times as a dragon depending on the visible details.

  There is also an interesting early koshigatana koshirae in that sale, although unfortunately there are some replacement parts done in silver.  I don't recall the lot number and my copy of the catalog seems to be in hiding.

  Jim
